conclusion: Identify the given information and relevant equations: m = 100, r = 10 Ω, R = 90 Ω, magnetic flux Φ varies sinusoidally with time.
EMF induced in a coil due to a changing magnetic flux is given by Faraday's law: E = -m dΦ/dt.
Magnetic flux Φ varies sinusoidally with time as shown in Figure Z.
General form of magnetic flux as a function of time is Φ(t) = Φ0 sin(ωt).
Maximum magnetic flux Φ0 is 2.0 x 10^-2 Wb from the graph.
Determine the period T of the sinusoidal variation from the graph, which is 6.28 x 10^-2 s.
Angular frequency ω is related to the period T by ω = 2π/T.
Calculate ω = 100 rad/s using T = 6.28 x 10^-2 s.
Calculate the maximum EMF using E = -m dΦ/dt.
Derivative of Φ(t) is dΦ/dt = Φ0 ω cos(ωt).
Maximum value of cos(ωt) is 1, so maximum EMF E_max is m Φ0 ω.
Substitute values to find E_max = 200 V.
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated by the alternating current generator is 200 V.
